newsitem.title: MEXICO: Alfa's Alpek ups stake in Tereftalatos.
newsitem.headline: Alfa's Alpek ups stake in Tereftalatos.

text.p: Mexican industrial group Alfa SA said on Monday that its Alpek subsidiary had acquired an additional 10 percent stake in Tereftalatos Mexicanos SA (Temex) from the Mexican federal government.
The move raised Alpek's participation in Temex to almost 92 percent. The remainder of the shares are held by U.S. oil company Amoco Corp.
The company did not disclose the total amount of the agreement.

"This transaction solidifies Alpek's strong position within the polyester chain. Anticipated growth in the soft drinks and the textile sectors continues to represent significant growth opportunities," said Juan Luis San Jose, vice president for planning and finance. Temex and another
Alpek unit, Petrocel, are Mexico's sole producers of Purified Terephtalic Acid (PTA) and Dimethyl-Terephtalate (DMT), the primary materials for polyester.
